intro: Erodium cheilanthifolium var. cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanilles' common eryngo, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, hairy fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. This variety is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
